page.title: 17R. S. C. in Newcastle
page.content: Since 1976 the{Theatre Royal}and the {Gulbenkian Studio}at the{Playhouse} have hosted the R. S. C. every spring for six-week season.Productions of Shakespeare classics as well as modern plays are shown to{Newcastle} audiences, augmented by{Cumbrian}and Scottish visitors, even before they reach the Barbican in London.The venture is funded by the Arts Council and the County Council. Arts Marketing report that audiences are getting younger.Specifically for younger people, the{Ballet Rambert} holds workshops and the Theatre Royal and Playhouse, school matinees.The {Northern Sinfonia}occasionally performs with the{Junior Philharmonic} and the Gulbenkian Studio holds a Youth Festival.The People's Theatre Youth section will tour America this summer.
